classes.name: DataMapping
classes.note: Mapping of port elements (data elements and parameters) to frames and signals.

introduction.note: This represents introductory documentation about the

classes.name: SenderReceiverToSignalMapping
classes.note: Mapping of a sender receiver communication data element to a signal.

senderToSignal.note: This mapping allows for the text-table translation between sending DataPrototype that is defined in the Port and the physicalProps defined for the System

signalTo.note: This mapping allows for the text-table translation between physicalProps defined for the SystemSignal and a DataPrototype that is defined in the Port

systemSignal.note: Reference to the system signal used to carry the data

classes.name: SenderReceiverToSignalGroupMapping
classes.note: Mapping of a sender receiver communication data element with a composite datatype to a signal group.

dataElement.note: mapped to a signal group. by: VariableDataPrototypeIn

signalGroup.note: Reference to the signal group, which contain all primitive the composite type

typeMapping.note: The CompositeTypeMapping maps the ApplicationArray and ApplicationRecordElements to Signals of

classes.name: SenderRecCompositeTypeMapping
classes.note: Two mappings exist for the composite data types: "ArrayTypeMapping" and "RecordTypeMapping". In both, a primitive datatype will be mapped to a system signal. But it is also possible to combine the arrays and the records, so that an "array" could be an element of a "record" and in the same manner a "record" could be an element of an "array". Nesting these data types is also possible. If an element of a composite data type is again a composite one, the "CompositeTypeMapping" element will be used one more time (aggregation between the ArrayElementMapping and CompositeType Mapping or aggregation between the RecordElementMapping and CompositeTypeMapping).

classes.name: SenderRecArrayTypeMapping
classes.note: If the ApplicationCompositeDataType is an Array, the "ArrayTypeMapping" will be used.

arrayElement.note: Each ApplicationArrayElement shall be mapped on a SystemSignal.

senderToSignal.note: This mapping allows for the text-table translation between sending DataPrototype that is defined in the Port and the physicalProps defined for the System

signalTo.note: This mapping allows for the text-table translation between physicalProps defined for the SystemSignal and a DataPrototype that is defined in the Port

classes.name: SenderRecRecordTypeMapping
classes.note: If the ApplicationCompositeDataType is a Record, the "RecordTypeMapping" will be used.

recordElement.note: Each ApplicationRecordElement shall be mapped on a SystemSignal.

classes.name: SenderRecRecordElementMapping
classes.note: Mapping of a primitive record element to a SystemSignal. If the VariableDataPrototype that is referenced by SenderReceiverToSignalGroupMapping is typed by an ApplicationDataType the reference application RecordElement shall be used. If the VariableDataPrototype is typed by the ImplementationDataType the reference implementationRecordElement shall be used. Either the implementationRecordElement or applicationRecordElement reference shall be used. If the element is composite, there will be no mapping to the SystemSignal (multiplicity 0). In this case the RecordElementMapping element will aggregate the complexTypeMapping element. In that way also the composite datatypes can be mapped to SystemSignals.

application.note: Reference to an ApplicationRecordElement in the context of the dataElement or in the context of a composite

complexType.note: This aggregation will be used if the element is composite.

implementation.note: Reference to an ImplementationRecordElement in the context of the dataElement or in the context of a

senderToSignal.note: This mapping allows for the text-table translation between sending DataPrototype that is defined in the Port and the physicalProps defined for the System

signalTo.note: This mapping allows for the text-table translation between physicalProps defined for the SystemSignal and a DataPrototype that is defined in the Port

systemSignal.note: Reference to the system signal used to carry the primitive

classes.name: SenderRecArrayElementMapping
classes.note: The SenderRecArrayElement may be a primitive one or a composite one. If the element is primitive, it will be mapped to the SystemSignal (multiplicity 1). If the VariableDataPrototype that is referenced by Sender ReceiverToSignalGroupMapping is typed by an ApplicationDataType the reference to the Application ArrayElement shall be used. If the VariableDataPrototype is typed by the ImplementationDataType the reference to the ImplementationArrayElement shall be used. If the element is composite, there will be no mapping to the SystemSignal (multiplicity 0). In this case the ArrayElementMapping element will aggregate the TypeMapping element. In that way also the composite datatypes can be mapped to SystemSignals. Regardless whether composite or primitive array element is mapped the indexed element always needs to be specified.

complexType.note: This aggregation will be used if the element is composite.

indexedArray.note: Reference to an indexed array element in the context of dataElement or in the context of a composite element.

systemSignal.note: Reference to the system signal used to carry the primitive

classes.name: IndexedArrayElement
classes.note: This element represents exactly one indexed element in the array. Either the applicationArrayElement or implementationArrayElement reference shall be used.

applicationArray.note: Reference to an ApplicationArrayElement in an array.

implementation.note: Reference to an ImplementationDataTypeElement in an array.

index.note: Position of an element in an array. Starting position is 0.

classes.name: ClientServerToSignalMapping
classes.note: This element maps the ClientServerOperation to call- and return-SystemSignals.

callSignal.note: Reference to the callSignal to which the IN and INOUT mapped.

clientServer.note: a call SystemSignal and a return SystemSignal. by: OperationInSystem

returnSignal.note: Reference to the returnSignal to which the OUT and are mapped.

classes.name: SenderReceiverCompositeElementToSignalMapping
classes.note: Mapping of an Variable Data Prototype which is aggregated within a composite datatype to a System Signal (only one element of the composite data type is mapped).

dataElement.note: one element is mapped to a SystemSignal. by: VariableDataPrototypeIn

systemSignal.note: Reference to the SystemSignal to which one primitive of type is mapped.

typeMapping.note: The CompositeTypeMapping maps one VariableData of the composite data type to a SystemSignal.

classes.name: TriggerToSignalMapping
classes.note: This meta-class represents the ability to map a trigger to a SystemSignal of size 0. The Trigger does not transport any other information than its existence, therefore the limitation in terms of signal length.

systemSignal.note: This is the SystemSignal taken to transport the Trigger network.

triggerRef.note: to a remote ECU. by: TriggerInSystemInstance
